basics.name: MADHAV RAJESH
basics.label: Master of Science in Computer Science Student
basics.summary: A proactive Master of Science in Computer Science student specializing in algorithms, cloud computing, and quantum computing. Experienced in software development and research with a robust foundation in data structures, machine learning, and full-stack development.

work.summary: Trained a CNN-RF model for real-time processing of rainforest audio; deployed an alert system with recycled phones for threat detection; achieved a 92.7% accuracy.
highlights: Processed 17,000+ hours of Rainforest Audio in real time.
Deployed an alert system instantly detecting threats such as chainsaws and trucks.

work.summary: Optimized a recommendation engine using RNN models for 1.5 million active users; implemented real-time data solutions with Redis Streams and Apache Spark.
highlights: Enhanced user experience by optimizing recommendation engine.
Achieved sub-20ms latency with real-time data solutions.
Boosted user engagement and session duration.

projects.name: Hybrid Cloud for Smart Education
projects.description: Engineered a scalable AWS Lambda-based application for live classroom video footage processing; utilized Ceph for object storage.
highlights: Handled 10,000+ video hours with 99.6% accuracy in student identification.
Reduced response times by 40% using OpenFaaS on Kubernetes.
Supported 5 TB of video data with enhanced data throughput by 50%.

projects.name: P4 DDoS Attack Detection
projects.description: Developed a P4-based DDoS detection system; showcased effectiveness on the FABRIC testbed with over 5 million requests per second.
highlights: Achieved 98.2% threat detection with minimal delay.
Identified 96% of attack packets with improved hashing.
Validated scalability and effectiveness on the FABRIC testbed.

volunteer.summary: Led a cross-functional team of 80 students in technical projects, organizing hackathons and workshops on Machine Learning and Web Development.
highlights: Led cross-functional team of 80 students in technical projects.
Organized 5 hackathons and 36 workshops, impacting 1,000+ students each semester.
